Faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
Faq.q1: What is the difference between Oil and Thai Massage?
Faq.a1: Thai Massage is performed fully clothed on a floor mat and involves stretching and pressure points. Oil Massage is performed on a table with skin contact using aromatic oils for relaxation.
Faq.q2: Does Thai Massage help with back pain?
Faq.a2: Yes, targeted stretching and acupressure in Thai Massage are highly effective for relieving back tension and improving mobility.
Faq.q3: Is Suksan Massage covered by insurance?
Faq.a3: We currently do not have a direct billing authorization from health insurance companies, despite our qualifications. However, with our fair pricing, we come close to the cost of a deductible with insurance billing.
Faq.a4: For Thai Massage, we provide comfortable traditional clothing. For Oil Massage, standard draping procedures are used to ensure your privacy and comfort.
Faq.a5: Yes, we have shower facilities available for our clients.
Faq.a6: During the day, there are blue zone parking slots on the street. In the evening, you can find parking spaces about 2 minutes away near Denner.
Faq.q7: Can I choose the massage intensity?
Faq.a7: Yes, you can specify if you prefer a relax, aroma, light, medium, or strong massage treatment.
Faq.q8: Do you offer Hot Stone, Thai Balm, or Oil?
Faq.a8: Yes, we provide specialized treatments using Hot Stones, traditional Thai medical balm, or oils for the best health benefits.
